reviews.title: Playa Pesquero - Solid 7/10
reviews.text: The hotel itself was a beautiful place, the rooms very big & decor lovely! It is a big complex so if you are far away from everywhere like my friend was just ask for another room & they should move you blocks! There is 2 restaurant buffets we found the white one to be better! Thats the 2nd 1 from reception. The pools are lovely, the beach is a short walk & very nice, free water sports for everyone at the sea. We had a couple of problems, 1, we had a kingsize bed & we had our 2 yr old with us & they gave us a cot which wasn't appropriate so we had our daughter with us for 2 weeks, but ask about all this at time of booking as an infant over there is age 3 & below even tho ya pay a child price! We didn't get a towel for her a place in the a la carte restaurant & no bed! The other thing was the a la carte restaurant on the beach, the seafood restaurant.... They were very busy & never had enough tables for us even though we had pre booked 3 days before, & they had a wedding on the beach to serve as well as the restaurant so we waited a very long time for a drink, & for our food, & when the food came it was presented very nice, we had lobster... but it was Well overcooked! It was a disappointment, very rubbery! We never went there again, it might av been cos they were too busy with the wedding party & the restaurant suffered! But the other a la carte's were very good!! And you get 4 a la carte's a week free!!! I Would advise to go to Le Bistro which is the one you pay for it was 15 cuban peso's about £10, but that was the best gorgeous meal we had outta the 2 weeks!! Its a must!!

reviews.title: Nice enough hotel - shame we had items taken from safe.
reviews.text: But all in all, this hotel is very beautiful, very nice staff, friendly & helpful! We would definately go back!! And please if you do go, go down town & take sum kids pencils crayons colouring books, toys anything as they are very poor! I took 2 bags full down & we handed them out to the kids at the refugee housing flats, which touched me a lot & makes ya realise just how lucky we are.... Have a good holiday any1 booking! :-)))

reviews.text: Judging from some other reviews you may now be waiting for the big "however, the food was blah blah" or something like that, or perhaps even the bizarre notion that 'cuba has food problems' would somehow be relevant to guests in a 5 star resort . We found the complete opposite in both the buffets and the more exclusive 'reserved' restaurants. Perhaps the presence of completely fresh, organic, milk in the buffets fazed people used to the mechanized cow pus we sometimes euphemize as milk here, but the complete spread from the vegetables, fruit, beef, pork, chicken, was absolutely on par and delicious. Steaks fried to order, omelettes made to order, freshly squeezed orange juice, pancakes fried up with little bannanas and spiked with a bit of rum, fresh tropical fruit....need I go on? Yes, there was no fast food in the literal trailertrash drive-thru sense, but presumably when one goes on vacation that's one of the things left behind, no? Or should we whine when something's new and different or god forbid *better*?
reviews.title: Good value winter break!!

reviews.text: The reserved restaurants were excellent. We got the Seafood, Caribbean, Romantico, and Gondola restaurants. The first two were quite good, but our favourites were the latter two. Staff had obviously trained for the honour of serving there and they did, overall, a very good job and in fact outstripped the service at almost any restaraunt I'd ever been to. The food, to us, compared to the finest we'd eaten in such cities as Vancouver or Toronto. The clientele, unfortunately, often compared to your local Dairy Queen and while that's not bad in itself it really disrespects the people and the whole idea of the restaurant. Despite people being told to dress up (as if they were 4th graders), often some would come with t-shirts and jeans and talk across tables and even feed stray cats their leftover food in full view of the kitchen and waiting staff who prepared it and brought it to them. The failure of the hotel to enforce some stricter codes of behaviour and attire in these retaurants was my biggest problem with the food situation.

reviews.text: We returned from our holiday to Playa Pequero on 9th February 2005 and am happy to report that we had the best time ever! This is a great hotel with tons of facilities to keep you amused, who cares if it's in the middle of nowhere (which technically it isn't by the way!). The hotel is massive, set in huge grounds which makes it feel like you're in a lillte resort so there's no need to venture out if you dont want to . We hired a car for 3 days and had a drive into the country, the scenery is beautiful. Other than the scenery though there's not much else to go and see, we didn't really need the car for the full 3 days. We drove into Holguin one day, expecting a tourist area with shops etc. There wasn't, believe me. Unless we went to the wrong place (Central Park) of course. We kind of just got stared at, we didn't feel unsafe at all, just out of place. Anyway, we'll put that one down to experience! One day we hired bikes from the hotel (no charge - bargain!) and had a ride down the road from the hotel. It was nice to meet some of the locals. If you get a chance to, nip in to the farm on the right hand side (as you come away from the hotel). There is a lovely couple who live there, very hospitable and they have lots of animals etc., great fun. Back to the hotel. If you can make your reservations for the a'la carte restaurants as soon as you arrive as they can get booked up quickly. Having said that, we had no problems whatsoever, even for the Romantico (which is great - very posh!). The rooms are excellent, very clean etc. We had no problems with the water, no problems with getting clean towels and no problems with the staff. They are extremely friendly and polite, the Cubans are great people! The pool is fantastic, the best we've ever experienced. It's huge so it never feels crowded. And yes it is cold, but not freezing as some have said. You're in a hot country, get over it! The beach is beautiful, lovely white sand and turquoise sea. You have to go on a catamaran, it's great fun! My husbands favourite thing was the beer garden (surprise surprise!). They serve icy beer in chilled glasses and chunky burgers to make your eyes water, not to mention the misty chicken! The only negatives really I would say are the toilets (can get a little smelly at times) and the wait at the lobby bar in the evenings. But hey, you're on holiday, who's in a rush? All in all this was a great holiday and we have no complaints. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. We have also been to a five star hotel in Mexico as some other users have mentioned and to be honest we think that this hotel is up there with the best of them. Have a geat holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just recently returned from a fabulous stay at PP (Jan 30 - Feb 6, 2008). We were a bit nervous after reading some of the negative comments...but as we had gotten an excellent price, we decided to take a chance. We arrived at PP shortly after noon, and had fully expected to have to kill some time at the beach or lobby before being checked into our rooms...but were pleasantly surprised that our rooms were ready. Our room was 3902 which ended up being on the extreme west side of the property...but we found that it was very quiet and serene -- we could also see all the stars at night. We found the room to be quite nice, the beds quite comfortable, nice little touches like an umbrella and free safe. Yes the room was slightly musty when entering...but this is the tropics after all.

reviews.text: The beach was beautiful --there was some great snorkeling at the extreme right of the beach (near the Blau Costa Verde hotel complex) - the 3 hotels Playa Pesquero, Playa Costa Verde and the Blau Costa Verde all are beside each other and share this amazing beach - you are free to walk anywhere along it, and we did this quite a few times - there are trails you can access on both the western and eastern sides of the beach which are a pleasant stroll. Another pleasant surprise here was there being lots of beach loungers - there was always 1 or 2 guys that would pull out a couple of loungers to where we wanted them - we would generally tip them 1 CUC peso.

reviews.title: Had a super time at Playa Pesquero
reviews.text: My husband and I returned from Playa Pesquero on Feb. 19th after a week's holiday there. We had misgivings after reading some of the negative letters on this website. Much to our pleasure, all negative feelings could not be found. It is definitely a 5 star hotel. We had NO water problems. The food in the a la carte restaurants was first class, everything from steak, to lobster tail and huge shrimp. The staff was friendly and very accomodating. It is a huge complex but it never appeared overly full because of the vast beach and lovely pool. There were a lot of weddings and apparently it was a good deal. Our room was very clean and maid service was excellent. There were plenty of towels, toilet paper etc. The hairdryers were working and free shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, shower cap, etc. was provided. I cannot think of a negative comment.
Just returned from vacationing at the resort Feb 6-13. It was a great experience!

reviews.text: After reading some of the earlier reviews, I'll admit I was concerned. People complaining about the water, bugs, food, service ---all unfounded from my experience.

Water not a problem, nor were the bugs. As far as the food, one cannot go with the expectation that the food will be exactly the same as they are used to, afterall, it is a different country and culture. The food, as they prepared it, was very good. There was never a problem finding something you like, as the variety was there to choose from. Some of the a la carte restaurants were open during the day as well, which was a bonus because it offered a nice change from the buffet. The beer garden, open 24hrs, offered up more "traditional" foods ---the cheeseburgers, bacon shrimp and misty chicken were all excellent.

It is after all a Communist country but one which offers those interested in history and cultural differences the opportunity to experience somenthing different. The people we met, mostly at the hotel or on trips were friendly and VERY PROUD, they see happy with "their lot" and perhaps there is a lesson to be learnt here.

That is perhaps one comment I would make about this resort - if you struggle with mobility it is spacious but for the majority there is no problem with distances, 5 minute walk to the beach from our room (6421).
